text: I'm the CEO of Blood Money Institute for
artificial intelligence which is based
in Mumbai
what money Institute for the visual
intelligence is an independent
not-for-profit set up with the aim of
developing AI based solutions for
societal domain problems areas like
agriculture health infrastructure
education Financial Inclusion and others
AWS is a natural choice for us because
it allows open innovation collaboration
with other innovators which has a not
for profit is important for us but it
also is easy to manage and it's agile so
we can scale to any size we want and it
also provides the right level of
security needed so when we are working
with sensitive public domain data it
becomes easy to use it so we create our
solutions on the cloud but at the same
time when you deploy and deliver the
solution it needs to be given to people
in the frontline for example frontline
health workers and rural areas and
connectivity may not always be there so
the delivery of the solution is actually
done on a cell phone in health for
example infant mortality is a big
challenge although the numbers have come
down they are not enough and a lot of it
actually can be detected if the baby's
weight was measured at the time of birth
we are actually developing an vision
based solution that will allow frontline
health worker to take a few pictures or
a short video with the cellphone camera
and then from that create a virtual 3d
shape of the baby and from that shape we
make various measurements and also
measure the volume which then translates
to weight you know when people think
about machine learning and AI they think
about large-scale commercial
applications which of course is
everywhere but you look at about 3
billion people in the world their lives
are not touched by what's going on in
the mainstream computing we envision a
future in which actually this power of
as well as the cloud computing color can
be used and applied to solve societal
problems for the three billion people
that are not getting help from AI drain
and these sort of things I think will be
enabled by AWS
[Music]
